page.title: 06STAINBY VILLAGE
page.content: Stainby has some 83 Residents, mainly consisting now of families who have moved into the area; very few original villagers are left. The old village community spirit no longer exists, many of the bread winners commute to work and the wives shop in the nearby town of Grantham or further afield. The land area in and around Stainby is mainly agricultural, crops being of barley, wheat, some rape & peas. The soil is of ironstone base, most of the land having been quarried and then reclaimed; as a result the quality is poor. Modern fertilizers enable crops to be grown in most areas; the craggier soil is used for grazing, mainly for sheep. The land it self is worked by tenant farmers - most of the area is owned by Buckminster Trust Estate, the largest land-owning Estate in the district, through most farmers
